p: Crude extracts of different botanical parts, limonoids ( 180– 182 and 207), and triterpenes ( 119, 121, 122, 127– 129, and 131– 133) from C. fissilis were tested for trypanocidal activity by Leite et al. [ 27] with a procedure for in vitro assays on blood trypomastigote forms of Trypanosoma cruzi, as previously described by Ambrozin et al. [ 91].
